description: Juxtaposed partitions of 1,2,3,... into distinct parts, ordered by number of terms and then lexicographically.
comments: This is the Abramowitz and Stegun ordering. - _Franklin T. Adams-Watters_, Apr 28 2006
links: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 1..32, flattened
M. Abramowitz and I. A. Stegun, eds., Handbook of Mathematical Functions, National Bureau of Standards, Applied Math. Series 55, Tenth Printing, 1972 [alternative scanned copy].
crossrefs: Cf. A118457, A118458 (partition lengths), A015723 (total row lengths), A036036, A000009, A246688.
author: _Clark Kimberling_
